TopicTitle: How real is KSP to you ?

Articles.Content: 2> Have you ever missed an appointment, work or family function because you were playing KSP ?
Wow, now that I consider it, If I had a pet I'd probably name it after a kerbal (Either Jebediah, Bill, Bob or Goeffel)

I kill kerbals at my leisure, until career mode says that that is a bad thing.

Not for fun, I dont want to kill, but I usually don't have a saftey... except F5 and F9
I sometimes break down in tears when a kerbal dies...
Well considering it takes up 1/5th of my day, on a good day, I would say its rather legitimate, in my opinion.
It's not real at all. Since October 1st, I have been able to play KSP.
I'd probably name my pet Jeb if it were up to me
I ruthlessly slaughter Kerbals for fun, but that makes them slightly more important than humans in my eyes.
Its all highs and lows to me.. 0's and 1's.. on's and off's
Everytime a kerbal dies. I.....I ..... I don't really care.
Every time a kerbal dies, I revert the flight...
Every time a Kerbal dies, another Kerbal gets a flight assignment.
I rarely if ever design a manned rocket without and escape system (which I test) nor do I send Kerbals on missions without a return plan.
Everytime a Kerbal dies I wear whole day just black.

I voted " will try to save my Kerbals if possible". I'd probably name a pet after a kerbal, but only after the names Tesla, Nikola, Laika, Armstrong, and Kaku were used up.

Edited October 16, 2013 by Flymetothemun
Clarification
I don't get realy far anyway, just a ton of exploding prototype exploding on the lanch pad

I have a very protective attitude toward my Kerbals, if i don't expect them to live on a mission i won't send them, they remind me of when i was playing Lemmings all those years ago, i just had to finish each level before turning the computer off because they felt alive.
